00031 /*
00032  * Quota Slave Driver (QSD) management.
00033  *
00034  * The quota slave feature is implemented under the form of a library called
00035  * QSD. Each OSD device should create a QSD instance via qsd_init() which will
00036  * be used to manage quota enforcement for this device. This implies:
00037  * - completing the reintegration procedure with the quota master (aka QMT, see
00038  *   qmt_dev.c) to retrieve the latest quota settings and space distribution.
00039  * - managing quota locks in order to be notified of configuration changes.
00040  * - acquiring space from the QMT when quota space for a given user/group is
00041  *   close to exhaustion.
00042  * - allocating quota space to service threads for local request processing.
00043  *
00044  * Once the QSD instance created, the OSD device should invoke qsd_start()
00045  * when recovery is completed. This notifies the QSD that we are about to
00046  * process new requests on which quota should be strictly enforced.
00047  * Then, qsd_op_begin/end can be used to reserve/release/pre-acquire quota space
00048  * for/after each operation until shutdown where the QSD instance should be
00049  * freed via qsd_fini().
00050  */
00051 
00052 #define DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM S_LQUOTA
00053 
00054 #include <obd_class.h>
00055 #include "qsd_internal.h"
00056 
00057 struct kmem_cache *upd_kmem;
00058 
00059 struct lu_kmem_descr qsd_caches[] = {
00060         {
00061                 .ckd_cache = &upd_kmem,
00062                 .ckd_name  = "upd_kmem",
00063                 .ckd_size  = sizeof(struct qsd_upd_rec)
00064         },
00065         {
00066                 .ckd_cache = NULL
00067         }
00068 };
00069 
00070 /* define qsd thread key */
00071 LU_KEY_INIT_FINI(qsd, struct qsd_thread_info);
00072 LU_CONTEXT_KEY_DEFINE(qsd, LCT_MD_THREAD | LCT_DT_THREAD | LCT_LOCAL);
00073 LU_KEY_INIT_GENERIC(qsd);
00074 
00075 /* some procfs helpers */
00076 static int qsd_state_seq_show(struct seq_file *m, void *data)
00077 {
00078         struct qsd_instance     *qsd = m->private;
00079         char                     enabled[5];
00080 
00081         LASSERT(qsd != NULL);
00082 
00083         memset(enabled, 0, sizeof(enabled));
00084         if (qsd_type_enabled(qsd, USRQUOTA))
00085                 strcat(enabled, "u");
00086         if (qsd_type_enabled(qsd, GRPQUOTA))
00087                 strcat(enabled, "g");
00088         if (strlen(enabled) == 0)
00089                 strcat(enabled, "none");
00090 
00091         seq_printf(m, "target name:    %s\n"
00092                    "pool ID:        %d\n"
00093                    "type:           %s\n"
00094                    "quota enabled:  %s\n"
00095                    "conn to master: %s\n",
00096                    qsd->qsd_svname, qsd->qsd_pool_id,
00097                    qsd->qsd_is_md ? "md" : "dt", enabled,
00098                    qsd->qsd_exp_valid ? "setup" : "not setup yet");
00099 
00100         if (qsd->qsd_prepared) {
00101                 memset(enabled, 0, sizeof(enabled));
00102                 if (qsd->qsd_type_array[USRQUOTA]->qqi_acct_obj != NULL)
00103                         strcat(enabled, "u");
00104                 if (qsd->qsd_type_array[GRPQUOTA]->qqi_acct_obj != NULL)
00105                         strcat(enabled, "g");
00106                 if (strlen(enabled) == 0)
00107                         strcat(enabled, "none");
00108                 seq_printf(m, "space acct:     %s\n"
00109                            "user uptodate:  glb[%d],slv[%d],reint[%d]\n"
00110                            "group uptodate: glb[%d],slv[%d],reint[%d]\n",
00111                            enabled,
00112                            qsd->qsd_type_array[USRQUOTA]->qqi_glb_uptodate,
00113                            qsd->qsd_type_array[USRQUOTA]->qqi_slv_uptodate,
00114                            qsd->qsd_type_array[USRQUOTA]->qqi_reint,
00115                            qsd->qsd_type_array[GRPQUOTA]->qqi_glb_uptodate,
00116                            qsd->qsd_type_array[GRPQUOTA]->qqi_slv_uptodate,
00117                            qsd->qsd_type_array[GRPQUOTA]->qqi_reint);
00118         }
00119         return 0;
00120 }
00121 LPROC_SEQ_FOPS_RO(qsd_state);

00123 static int qsd_enabled_seq_show(struct seq_file *m, void *data)
00124 {
00125         struct qsd_instance     *qsd = m->private;
00126         char                     enabled[5];
00127 
00128         LASSERT(qsd != NULL);
00129 
00130         memset(enabled, 0, sizeof(enabled));
00131         if (qsd_type_enabled(qsd, USRQUOTA))
00132                 strcat(enabled, "u");
00133         if (qsd_type_enabled(qsd, GRPQUOTA))
00134                 strcat(enabled, "g");
00135         if (strlen(enabled) == 0)
00136                 strcat(enabled, "none");
00137 
00138         seq_printf(m, "%s\n", enabled);
00139         return 0;
00140 }
00141 LPROC_SEQ_FOPS_RO(qsd_enabled);
00142 
00143 /* force reintegration procedure to be executed.
00144  * Used for test/debugging purpose */
00145 static ssize_t
00146 lprocfs_force_reint_seq_write(struct file *file, const char __user *buffer,
00147                                 size_t count, loff_t *off)
00148 {
00149         struct qsd_instance *qsd = ((struct seq_file *)file->private_data)->private;
00150         int                  rc = 0, qtype;
00151 
00152         LASSERT(qsd != NULL);
00153 
00154         write_lock(&qsd->qsd_lock);
00155         if (qsd->qsd_stopping) {
00156                 /* don't mess up with shutdown procedure, it is already
00157                  * complicated enough */
00158                 rc = -ESHUTDOWN;
00159         } else if (!qsd->qsd_prepared) {
00160                 rc = -EAGAIN;
00161         } else {
00162                 /* mark all indexes as stale */
00163                 for (qtype = USRQUOTA; qtype < MAXQUOTAS; qtype++) {
00164                         qsd->qsd_type_array[qtype]->qqi_glb_uptodate = false;
00165                         qsd->qsd_type_array[qtype]->qqi_slv_uptodate = false;
00166                 }
00167         }
00168         write_unlock(&qsd->qsd_lock);
00169 
00170         if (rc)
00171                 return rc;
00172 
00173         /* kick off reintegration */
00174         for (qtype = USRQUOTA; qtype < MAXQUOTAS; qtype++) {
00175                 rc = qsd_start_reint_thread(qsd->qsd_type_array[qtype]);
00176                 if (rc)
00177                         break;
00178         }
00179         return rc == 0 ? count : rc;
00180 }
00181 LPROC_SEQ_FOPS_WO_TYPE(qsd, force_reint);
00182 
00183 static int qsd_timeout_seq_show(struct seq_file *m, void *data)
00184 {
00185         struct qsd_instance *qsd = m->private;
00186         LASSERT(qsd != NULL);
00187 
00188         seq_printf(m, "%d\n", qsd_wait_timeout(qsd));
00189         return 0;
00190 }
00191 
00192 static ssize_t
00193 qsd_timeout_seq_write(struct file *file, const char __user *buffer,
00194                         size_t count, loff_t *off)
00195 {
00196         struct qsd_instance *qsd = ((struct seq_file *)file->private_data)->private;
00197         int rc;
00198         __s64 timeout;
00199         LASSERT(qsd != NULL);
00200 
00201         rc = lprocfs_str_to_s64(buffer, count, &timeout);
00202         if (rc)
00203                 return rc;
00204         if (timeout < 0 || timeout > INT_MAX)
00205                 return -EINVAL;
00206 
00207         qsd->qsd_timeout = timeout;
00208         return count;
00209 }
00210 LPROC_SEQ_FOPS(qsd_timeout);

00212 static struct lprocfs_vars lprocfs_quota_qsd_vars[] = {
00213         { .name =       "info",
00214           .fops =       &qsd_state_fops         },
00215         { .name =       "enabled",
00216           .fops =       &qsd_enabled_fops       },
00217         { .name =       "force_reint",
00218           .fops =       &qsd_force_reint_fops   },
00219         { .name =       "timeout",
00220           .fops =       &qsd_timeout_fops       },
00221         { NULL }
00222 };

00224 /*
00225  * Callback function invoked by the OSP layer when the connection to the master
00226  * has been set up.
00227  *
00228  * \param data - is a pointer to the qsd_instance
00229  *
00230  * \retval - 0 on success, appropriate error on failure
00231  */
00232 static int qsd_conn_callback(void *data)
00233 {
00234         struct qsd_instance *qsd = (struct qsd_instance *)data;
00235         int                  type;
00236         ENTRY;
00237 
00238         /* qsd_exp should now be valid */
00239         LASSERT(qsd->qsd_exp);
00240 
00241         qsd->qsd_ns = class_exp2obd(qsd->qsd_exp)->obd_namespace;
00242 
00243         write_lock(&qsd->qsd_lock);
00244         /* notify that qsd_exp is now valid */
00245         qsd->qsd_exp_valid = true;
00246         write_unlock(&qsd->qsd_lock);
00247 
00248         /* Now that the connection to master is setup, we can initiate the
00249          * reintegration procedure for quota types which are enabled.
00250          * It is worth noting that, if the qsd_instance hasn't been started
00251          * already, then we can only complete the first two steps of the
00252          * reintegration procedure (i.e. global lock enqueue and slave
00253          * index transfer) since the space usage reconciliation (i.e.
00254          * step 3) will have to wait for qsd_start() to be called */
00255         for (type = USRQUOTA; type < MAXQUOTAS; type++) {
00256                 struct qsd_qtype_info *qqi = qsd->qsd_type_array[type];
00257                 wake_up(&qqi->qqi_reint_thread.t_ctl_waitq);
00258         }
00259 
00260         RETURN(0);
00261 }
00262 
00263 /*
00264  * Release qsd_qtype_info structure which contains data associated with a
00265  * given quota type. This releases the accounting objects.
00266  * It's called on OSD cleanup when the qsd instance is released.
00267  *
00268  * \param env - is the environment passed by the caller
00269  * \param qsd - is the qsd instance managing the qsd_qtype_info structure
00270  *              to be released
00271  * \param qtype - is the quota type to be shutdown
00272  */
00273 static void qsd_qtype_fini(const struct lu_env *env, struct qsd_instance *qsd,
00274                            int qtype)
00275 {
00276         struct qsd_qtype_info   *qqi;
00277         int repeat = 0;
00278         ENTRY;
00279 
00280         if (qsd->qsd_type_array[qtype] == NULL)
00281                 RETURN_EXIT;
00282         qqi = qsd->qsd_type_array[qtype];
00283         qsd->qsd_type_array[qtype] = NULL;
00284 
00285         /* all deferred work lists should be empty */
00286         LASSERT(list_empty(&qqi->qqi_deferred_glb));
00287         LASSERT(list_empty(&qqi->qqi_deferred_slv));
00288 
00289         /* shutdown lquota site */
00290         if (qqi->qqi_site != NULL && !IS_ERR(qqi->qqi_site)) {
00291                 lquota_site_free(env, qqi->qqi_site);
00292                 qqi->qqi_site = NULL;
00293         }
00294 
00295         /* The qqi may still be holding by global locks which are being
00296          * canceled asynchronously (LU-4365), see the following steps:
00297          *
00298          * - On server umount, we try to clear all quota locks first by
00299          *   disconnecting LWP (which will invalidate import and cleanup
00300          *   all locks on it), however, if quota reint process is holding
00301          *   the global lock for reintegration at that time, global lock
00302          *   will fail to be cleared on LWP disconnection.
00303          *
00304          * - Umount process goes on and stops reint process, the global
00305          *   lock will be dropped on reint process exit, however, the lock
00306          *   cancel in done in asynchronous way, so the
00307          *   qsd_glb_blocking_ast() might haven't been called yet when we
00308          *   get here.
00309          */
00310         while (atomic_read(&qqi->qqi_ref) > 1) {
00311                 CDEBUG(D_QUOTA, "qqi reference count %u, repeat: %d\n",
00312                        atomic_read(&qqi->qqi_ref), repeat);
00313                 repeat++;
00314                 set_current_state(TASK_INTERRUPTIBLE);
00315                 schedule_timeout(cfs_time_seconds(1));
00316         }
00317 
00318         /* by now, all qqi users should have gone away */
00319         LASSERT(atomic_read(&qqi->qqi_ref) == 1);
00320         lu_ref_fini(&qqi->qqi_reference);
00321 
00322         /* release accounting object */
00323         if (qqi->qqi_acct_obj != NULL && !IS_ERR(qqi->qqi_acct_obj)) {
00324                 lu_object_put(env, &qqi->qqi_acct_obj->do_lu);
00325                 qqi->qqi_acct_obj = NULL;
00326         }
00327 
00328         /* release slv index */
00329         if (qqi->qqi_slv_obj != NULL && !IS_ERR(qqi->qqi_slv_obj)) {
00330                 lu_object_put(env, &qqi->qqi_slv_obj->do_lu);
00331                 qqi->qqi_slv_obj = NULL;
00332                 qqi->qqi_slv_ver = 0;
00333         }
00334 
00335         /* release global index */
00336         if (qqi->qqi_glb_obj != NULL && !IS_ERR(qqi->qqi_glb_obj)) {
00337                 lu_object_put(env, &qqi->qqi_glb_obj->do_lu);
00338                 qqi->qqi_glb_obj = NULL;
00339                 qqi->qqi_glb_ver = 0;
00340         }
00341 
00342         OBD_FREE_PTR(qqi);
00343         EXIT;
00344 }
00345 
00346 /*
00347  * Allocate and initialize a qsd_qtype_info structure for quota type \qtype.
00348  * This opens the accounting object and initializes the proc file.
00349  * It's called on OSD start when the qsd_prepare() is invoked on the qsd
00350  * instance.
00351  *
00352  * \param env  - the environment passed by the caller
00353  * \param qsd  - is the qsd instance which will be in charge of the new
00354  *               qsd_qtype_info instance.
00355  * \param qtype - is quota type to set up
00356  *
00357  * \retval - 0 on success and qsd->qsd_type_array[qtype] is allocated,
00358  *           appropriate error on failure
00359  */
00360 static int qsd_qtype_init(const struct lu_env *env, struct qsd_instance *qsd,
00361                           int qtype)
00362 {
00363         struct qsd_qtype_info   *qqi;
00364         int                      rc;
00365         struct obd_uuid          uuid;
00366         ENTRY;
00367 
00368         LASSERT(qsd->qsd_type_array[qtype] == NULL);
00369 
00370         /* allocate structure for this quota type */
00371         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(qqi);
00372         if (qqi == NULL)
00373                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00374         qsd->qsd_type_array[qtype] = qqi;
00375         atomic_set(&qqi->qqi_ref, 1); /* referenced from qsd */
00376 
00377         /* set backpointer and other parameters */
00378         qqi->qqi_qsd   = qsd;
00379         qqi->qqi_qtype = qtype;
00380         lu_ref_init(&qqi->qqi_reference);
00381         lquota_generate_fid(&qqi->qqi_fid, qsd->qsd_pool_id, QSD_RES_TYPE(qsd),
00382                             qtype);
00383         qqi->qqi_glb_uptodate = false;
00384         qqi->qqi_slv_uptodate = false;
00385         qqi->qqi_reint        = false;
00386         init_waitqueue_head(&qqi->qqi_reint_thread.t_ctl_waitq);
00387         thread_set_flags(&qqi->qqi_reint_thread, SVC_STOPPED);
00388         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&qqi->qqi_deferred_glb);
00389         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&qqi->qqi_deferred_slv);
00390 
00391         /* open accounting object */
00392         LASSERT(qqi->qqi_acct_obj == NULL);
00393         qqi->qqi_acct_obj = acct_obj_lookup(env, qsd->qsd_dev, qtype);
00394         if (IS_ERR(qqi->qqi_acct_obj)) {
00395                 CDEBUG(D_QUOTA, "%s: no %s space accounting support rc:%ld\n",
00396                        qsd->qsd_svname, QTYPE_NAME(qtype),
00397                        PTR_ERR(qqi->qqi_acct_obj));
00398                 qqi->qqi_acct_obj = NULL;
00399                 qsd->qsd_acct_failed = true;
00400         }
00401 
00402         /* open global index copy */
00403         LASSERT(qqi->qqi_glb_obj == NULL);
00404         qqi->qqi_glb_obj = lquota_disk_glb_find_create(env, qsd->qsd_dev,
00405                                                        qsd->qsd_root,
00406                                                        &qqi->qqi_fid, true);
00407         if (IS_ERR(qqi->qqi_glb_obj)) {
00408                 CERROR("%s: can't open global index copy "DFID" %ld\n",
00409                        qsd->qsd_svname, PFID(&qqi->qqi_fid),
00410                        PTR_ERR(qqi->qqi_glb_obj));
00411                 GOTO(out, rc = PTR_ERR(qqi->qqi_glb_obj));
00412         }
00413         qqi->qqi_glb_ver = dt_version_get(env, qqi->qqi_glb_obj);
00414 
00415         /* open slave index copy */
00416         LASSERT(qqi->qqi_slv_obj == NULL);
00417         obd_str2uuid(&uuid, qsd->qsd_svname);
00418         qqi->qqi_slv_obj = lquota_disk_slv_find_create(env, qsd->qsd_dev,
00419                                                        qsd->qsd_root,
00420                                                        &qqi->qqi_fid, &uuid,
00421                                                        true);
00422         if (IS_ERR(qqi->qqi_slv_obj)) {
00423                 CERROR("%s: can't open slave index copy "DFID" %ld\n",
00424                        qsd->qsd_svname, PFID(&qqi->qqi_fid),
00425                        PTR_ERR(qqi->qqi_slv_obj));
00426                 GOTO(out, rc = PTR_ERR(qqi->qqi_slv_obj));
00427         }
00428         qqi->qqi_slv_ver = dt_version_get(env, qqi->qqi_slv_obj);
00429 
00430         /* allocate site */
00431         qqi->qqi_site = lquota_site_alloc(env, qqi, false, qtype, &qsd_lqe_ops);
00432         if (IS_ERR(qqi->qqi_site)) {
00433                 CERROR("%s: can't allocate site "DFID" %ld\n", qsd->qsd_svname,
00434                        PFID(&qqi->qqi_fid), PTR_ERR(qqi->qqi_site));
00435                 GOTO(out, rc = PTR_ERR(qqi->qqi_site));
00436         }
00437 
00438         /* register proc entry for accounting & global index copy objects */
00439         rc = lprocfs_seq_create(qsd->qsd_proc,
00440                                 qtype == USRQUOTA ? "acct_user" : "acct_group",
00441                                 0444, &lprocfs_quota_seq_fops,
00442                                 qqi->qqi_acct_obj);
00443         if (rc) {
00444                 CERROR("%s: can't add procfs entry for accounting file %d\n",
00445                        qsd->qsd_svname, rc);
00446                 GOTO(out, rc);
00447         }
00448 
00449         rc = lprocfs_seq_create(qsd->qsd_proc,
00450                                 qtype == USRQUOTA ? "limit_user" : "limit_group",
00451                                 0444, &lprocfs_quota_seq_fops,
00452                                 qqi->qqi_glb_obj);
00453         if (rc) {
00454                 CERROR("%s: can't add procfs entry for global index copy %d\n",
00455                        qsd->qsd_svname, rc);
00456                 GOTO(out, rc);
00457         }
00458         EXIT;
00459 out:
00460         if (rc)
00461                 qsd_qtype_fini(env, qsd, qtype);
00462         return rc;
00463 }
00464 
00465 /*
00466  * Release a qsd_instance. Companion of qsd_init(). This releases all data
00467  * structures associated with the quota slave (on-disk objects, lquota entry
00468  * tables, ...).
00469  * This function should be called when the OSD is shutting down.
00470  *
00471  * \param env - is the environment passed by the caller
00472  * \param qsd - is the qsd instance to shutdown
00473  */
00474 void qsd_fini(const struct lu_env *env, struct qsd_instance *qsd)
00475 {
00476         int     qtype;
00477         ENTRY;
00478 
00479         if (unlikely(qsd == NULL))
00480                 RETURN_EXIT;
00481 
00482         CDEBUG(D_QUOTA, "%s: initiating QSD shutdown\n", qsd->qsd_svname);
00483         write_lock(&qsd->qsd_lock);
00484         qsd->qsd_stopping = true;
00485         write_unlock(&qsd->qsd_lock);
00486 
00487         /* remove qsd proc entry */
00488         if (qsd->qsd_proc != NULL) {
00489                 lprocfs_remove(&qsd->qsd_proc);
00490                 qsd->qsd_proc = NULL;
00491         }
00492 
00493         /* stop the writeback thread */
00494         qsd_stop_upd_thread(qsd);
00495 
00496         /* shutdown the reintegration threads */
00497         for (qtype = USRQUOTA; qtype < MAXQUOTAS; qtype++) {
00498                 if (qsd->qsd_type_array[qtype] == NULL)
00499                         continue;
00500                 qsd_stop_reint_thread(qsd->qsd_type_array[qtype]);
00501         }
00502 
00503         if (qsd->qsd_ns != NULL) {
00504                 qsd->qsd_ns = NULL;
00505         }
00506 
00507         /* free per-quota type data */
00508         for (qtype = USRQUOTA; qtype < MAXQUOTAS; qtype++)
00509                 qsd_qtype_fini(env, qsd, qtype);
00510 
00511         /* deregister connection to the quota master */
00512         qsd->qsd_exp_valid = false;
00513         lustre_deregister_lwp_item(&qsd->qsd_exp);
00514 
00515         /* release per-filesystem information */
00516         if (qsd->qsd_fsinfo != NULL) {
00517                 mutex_lock(&qsd->qsd_fsinfo->qfs_mutex);
00518                 /* remove from the list of fsinfo */
00519                 list_del_init(&qsd->qsd_link);
00520                 mutex_unlock(&qsd->qsd_fsinfo->qfs_mutex);
00521                 qsd_put_fsinfo(qsd->qsd_fsinfo);
00522                 qsd->qsd_fsinfo = NULL;
00523         }
00524 
00525         /* release quota root directory */
00526         if (qsd->qsd_root != NULL) {
00527                 lu_object_put(env, &qsd->qsd_root->do_lu);
00528                 qsd->qsd_root = NULL;
00529         }
00530 
00531         /* release reference on dt_device */
00532         if (qsd->qsd_dev != NULL) {
00533                 lu_ref_del(&qsd->qsd_dev->dd_lu_dev.ld_reference, "qsd", qsd);
00534                 lu_device_put(&qsd->qsd_dev->dd_lu_dev);
00535                 qsd->qsd_dev = NULL;
00536         }
00537 
00538         CDEBUG(D_QUOTA, "%s: QSD shutdown completed\n", qsd->qsd_svname);
00539         OBD_FREE_PTR(qsd);
00540         EXIT;
00541 }
00542 EXPORT_SYMBOL(qsd_fini);
00543 
00544 /*
00545  * Create a new qsd_instance to be associated with backend osd device
00546  * identified by \dev.
00547  *
00548  * \param env    - the environment passed by the caller
00549  * \param svname - is the service name of the OSD device creating this instance
00550  * \param dev    - is the dt_device where to store quota index files
00551  * \param osd_proc - is the procfs parent directory where to create procfs file
00552  *                   related to this new qsd instance
00553  *
00554  * \retval - pointer to new qsd_instance associated with dev \dev on success,
00555  *           appropriate error on failure
00556  */
00557 struct qsd_instance *qsd_init(const struct lu_env *env, char *svname,
00558                               struct dt_device *dev,
00559                               struct proc_dir_entry *osd_proc)
00560 {
00561         struct qsd_thread_info  *qti = qsd_info(env);
00562         struct qsd_instance     *qsd;
00563         int                      rc, type, idx;
00564         ENTRY;
00565 
00566         /* only configure qsd for MDT & OST */
00567         type = server_name2index(svname, &idx, NULL);
00568         if (type != LDD_F_SV_TYPE_MDT && type != LDD_F_SV_TYPE_OST)
00569                 RETURN(NULL);
00570 
00571         /* allocate qsd instance */
00572         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(qsd);
00573         if (qsd == NULL)
00574                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM));
00575 
00576         /* generic initializations */
00577         rwlock_init(&qsd->qsd_lock);
00578         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&qsd->qsd_link);
00579         thread_set_flags(&qsd->qsd_upd_thread, SVC_STOPPED);
00580         init_waitqueue_head(&qsd->qsd_upd_thread.t_ctl_waitq);
00581         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&qsd->qsd_upd_list);
00582         spin_lock_init(&qsd->qsd_adjust_lock);
00583         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&qsd->qsd_adjust_list);
00584         qsd->qsd_prepared = false;
00585         qsd->qsd_started = false;
00586 
00587         /* copy service name */
00588         if (strlcpy(qsd->qsd_svname, svname, sizeof(qsd->qsd_svname))
00589             >= sizeof(qsd->qsd_svname))
00590                 GOTO(out, rc = -E2BIG);
00591 
00592         /* grab reference on osd device */
00593         lu_device_get(&dev->dd_lu_dev);
00594         lu_ref_add(&dev->dd_lu_dev.ld_reference, "qsd", qsd);
00595         qsd->qsd_dev = dev;
00596 
00597         /* we only support pool ID 0 (default data or metadata pool) for the
00598          * time being. A different pool ID could be assigned to this target via
00599          * the configuration log in the future */
00600         qsd->qsd_pool_id  = 0;
00601 
00602         /* get fsname from svname */
00603         rc = server_name2fsname(svname, qti->qti_buf, NULL);
00604         if (rc) {
00605                 CERROR("%s: fail to extract filesystem name\n", svname);
00606                 GOTO(out, rc);
00607         }
00608 
00609         /* look up quota setting for the filesystem the target belongs to */
00610         qsd->qsd_fsinfo = qsd_get_fsinfo(qti->qti_buf, 1);
00611         if (qsd->qsd_fsinfo == NULL) {
00612                 CERROR("%s: failed to locate filesystem information\n", svname);
00613                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
00614         }
00615 
00616         /* add in the list of lquota_fsinfo */
00617         mutex_lock(&qsd->qsd_fsinfo->qfs_mutex);
00618         list_add_tail(&qsd->qsd_link, &qsd->qsd_fsinfo->qfs_qsd_list);
00619         mutex_unlock(&qsd->qsd_fsinfo->qfs_mutex);
00620 
00621         /* register procfs directory */
00622         qsd->qsd_proc = lprocfs_register(QSD_DIR, osd_proc,
00623                                          lprocfs_quota_qsd_vars, qsd);
00624         if (IS_ERR(qsd->qsd_proc)) {
00625                 rc = PTR_ERR(qsd->qsd_proc);
00626                 qsd->qsd_proc = NULL;
00627                 CERROR("%s: fail to create quota slave proc entry (%d)\n",
00628                        svname, rc);
00629                 GOTO(out, rc);
00630         }
00631         EXIT;
00632 out:
00633         if (rc) {
00634                 qsd_fini(env, qsd);
00635                 return ERR_PTR(rc);
00636         }
00637         RETURN(qsd);
00638 }
00639 EXPORT_SYMBOL(qsd_init);
00640 
00641 /*
00642  * Initialize on-disk structures in order to manage quota enforcement for
00643  * the target associated with the qsd instance \qsd and starts the reintegration
00644  * procedure for each quota type as soon as possible.
00645  * The last step of the reintegration will be completed once qsd_start() is
00646  * called, at which points the space reconciliation with the master will be
00647  * executed.
00648  * This function must be called when the server stack is fully configured,
00649  * typically when ->ldo_prepare is called across the stack.
00650  *
00651  * \param env - the environment passed by the caller
00652  * \param qsd - is qsd_instance to prepare
00653  *
00654  * \retval - 0 on success, appropriate error on failure
00655  */
00656 int qsd_prepare(const struct lu_env *env, struct qsd_instance *qsd)
00657 {
00658         struct qsd_thread_info  *qti = qsd_info(env);
00659         int                      qtype, rc = 0;
00660         ENTRY;
00661 
00662         if (unlikely(qsd == NULL))
00663                 RETURN(0);
00664 
00665         read_lock(&qsd->qsd_lock);
00666         if (qsd->qsd_prepared) {
00667                 CERROR("%s: qsd instance already prepared\n", qsd->qsd_svname);
00668                 rc = -EALREADY;
00669         }
00670         read_unlock(&qsd->qsd_lock);
00671         if (rc)
00672                 RETURN(rc);
00673 
00674         /* Record whether this qsd instance is managing quota enforcement for a
00675          * MDT (i.e. inode quota) or OST (block quota) */
00676         if (lu_device_is_md(qsd->qsd_dev->dd_lu_dev.ld_site->ls_top_dev)) {
00677                 qsd->qsd_is_md = true;
00678                 qsd->qsd_sync_threshold = LQUOTA_LEAST_QUNIT(LQUOTA_RES_MD);
00679         } else {
00680                 qsd->qsd_sync_threshold = LQUOTA_LEAST_QUNIT(LQUOTA_RES_DT);
00681         }
00682 
00683         /* look-up on-disk directory for the quota slave */
00684         qsd->qsd_root = lquota_disk_dir_find_create(env, qsd->qsd_dev, NULL,
00685                                                     QSD_DIR);
00686         if (IS_ERR(qsd->qsd_root)) {
00687                 rc = PTR_ERR(qsd->qsd_root);
00688                 qsd->qsd_root = NULL;
00689                 CERROR("%s: failed to create quota slave root dir (%d)\n",
00690                        qsd->qsd_svname, rc);
00691                 RETURN(rc);
00692         }
00693 
00694         /* initialize per-quota type data */
00695         for (qtype = USRQUOTA; qtype < MAXQUOTAS; qtype++) {
00696                 rc = qsd_qtype_init(env, qsd, qtype);
00697                 if (rc)
00698                         RETURN(rc);
00699         }
00700 
00701         /* pools successfully setup, mark the qsd as prepared */
00702         write_lock(&qsd->qsd_lock);
00703         qsd->qsd_prepared = true;
00704         write_unlock(&qsd->qsd_lock);
00705 
00706         /* start reintegration thread for each type, if required */
00707         for (qtype = USRQUOTA; qtype < MAXQUOTAS; qtype++) {
00708                 struct qsd_qtype_info   *qqi = qsd->qsd_type_array[qtype];
00709 
00710                 if (qsd_type_enabled(qsd, qtype) && qsd->qsd_acct_failed) {
00711                         LCONSOLE_ERROR("%s: can't enable quota enforcement "
00712                                        "since space accounting isn't functional"
00713                                        ". Please run tunefs.lustre --quota on "
00714                                        "an unmounted filesystem if not done "
00715                                        "already\n", qsd->qsd_svname);
00716                         break;
00717                 }
00718 
00719                 rc = qsd_start_reint_thread(qqi);
00720                 if (rc) {
00721                         CERROR("%s: failed to start reint thread for type %s "
00722                                "(%d)\n", qsd->qsd_svname, QTYPE_NAME(qtype),
00723                                rc);
00724                         RETURN(rc);
00725                 }
00726         }
00727 
00728         /* start writeback thread */
00729         rc = qsd_start_upd_thread(qsd);
00730         if (rc) {
00731                 CERROR("%s: failed to start writeback thread (%d)\n",
00732                        qsd->qsd_svname, rc);
00733                 RETURN(rc);
00734         }
00735 
00736         /* generate osp name */
00737         rc = tgt_name2lwp_name(qsd->qsd_svname, qti->qti_buf,
00738                                MTI_NAME_MAXLEN, 0);
00739         if (rc) {
00740                 CERROR("%s: failed to generate ospname (%d)\n",
00741                        qsd->qsd_svname, rc);
00742                 RETURN(rc);
00743         }
00744 
00745         /* the connection callback will start the reintegration
00746          * procedure if quota is enabled */
00747         rc = lustre_register_lwp_item(qti->qti_buf, &qsd->qsd_exp,
00748                                       qsd_conn_callback, (void *)qsd);
00749         if (rc) {
00750                 CERROR("%s: fail to get connection to master (%d)\n",
00751                        qsd->qsd_svname, rc);
00752                 RETURN(rc);
00753         }
00754 
00755         RETURN(0);
00756 }
00757 EXPORT_SYMBOL(qsd_prepare);
00758 
00759 /*
00760  * Start a qsd instance. This will complete the last step of the reintegration
00761  * procedure as soon as possible (provided that the master is reachable).
00762  * This should be called when recovery has been completed and quota should now
00763  * be enforced on every operations.
00764  *
00765  * \param env - the environment passed by the caller
00766  * \param qsd - is the qsd instance associated with the osd device to start
00767  */
00768 int qsd_start(const struct lu_env *env, struct qsd_instance *qsd)
00769 {
00770         int     type, rc = 0;
00771         ENTRY;
00772 
00773         if (unlikely(qsd == NULL))
00774                 RETURN(0);
00775 
00776         write_lock(&qsd->qsd_lock);
00777         if (!qsd->qsd_prepared) {
00778                 CERROR("%s: can't start qsd instance since it wasn't properly "
00779                        "initialized\n", qsd->qsd_svname);
00780                 rc = -EFAULT;
00781         } else if (qsd->qsd_started) {
00782                 CERROR("%s: qsd instance already started\n", qsd->qsd_svname);
00783                 rc = -EALREADY;
00784         } else {
00785                 /* notify that the qsd_instance is now started */
00786                 qsd->qsd_started = true;
00787         }
00788         write_unlock(&qsd->qsd_lock);
00789 
00790         if (rc)
00791                 RETURN(rc);
00792 
00793         /* Trigger the 3rd step of reintegration: If usage > granted, acquire
00794          * up to usage; If usage < granted, release down to usage.  */
00795         for (type = USRQUOTA; type < MAXQUOTAS; type++) {
00796                 struct qsd_qtype_info   *qqi = qsd->qsd_type_array[type];
00797                 wake_up(&qqi->qqi_reint_thread.t_ctl_waitq);
00798         }
00799 
00800         RETURN(rc);
00801 }
00802 EXPORT_SYMBOL(qsd_start);
00803 
00804 void lustre_register_quota_process_config(int (*qpc)(struct lustre_cfg *lcfg));
00805 
00806 /*
00807  * Global initialization performed at module load time
00808  */
00809 int qsd_glb_init(void)
00810 {
00811         int     rc;
00812 
00813         rc = lu_kmem_init(qsd_caches);
00814         if (rc)
00815                 return rc;
00816 
00817         qsd_key_init_generic(&qsd_thread_key, NULL);
00818         lu_context_key_register(&qsd_thread_key);
00819         lustre_register_quota_process_config(qsd_process_config);
00820 
00821         return 0;
00822 }
00823 
00824 /*
00825  * Companion of qsd_glb_init() called at module unload time
00826  */
00827 void qsd_glb_fini(void)
00828 {
00829         lustre_register_quota_process_config(NULL);
00830         lu_kmem_fini(qsd_caches);
00831         lu_context_key_degister(&qsd_thread_key);
00832 }
